FT Faculty Headcount:
Overview:
The Spring 2024 Excel file presents Central Connecticut State University’s Faculty & Student Credit Hour, Student Headcount Report. It details teaching loads, course sections, student enrollment, and credit hours across departments, broken down between full-time (FT) and part-time (PT) faculty. The report also includes the percentage of credit hours taught by each group, highlighting differences in instructional responsibility.

Abbreviations Explained:

FT = Full-Time (faculty employed full-time)

PT = Part-Time (faculty employed part-time)

Faculty Headcount = Number of faculty teaching courses

Student Credit Hr = Total student credit hours taught (measure of workload)

Credit Hr/Faculty = Average credit hours per faculty member

Student Headcount = Total number of students taught in faculty courses

Student Headcount/Faculty = Average number of students per faculty member

Sections Taught = Number of course sections delivered

% Credit Hr by FT Faculty / PT Faculty = Share of total credit hours taught by full-time vs. part-time faculty
